attributes.action: Stop depriving the british taxpayer the right to manage his/her share portfolio by refusing to allow them to vote on activities of RBS
attributes.additional_details: Since RBS is owned by the taxpayer then it is the taxpayer who should be allowed to exercise his or her legal right to vote on what goes on in RBS.  The government has repeatedly demonstrated that it does not have the interests of the taxpayer in mind in its dealings with the company.  And NOBODY has asked me if I wish to appoint the Prime Minister as my proxy vote at the AGM.  Many of us have shares in companies and many of us exercise our right to vote.  Why are we not allowed a vote in a company in which we have shares - RBS?
